dialogues.text: Paitent Zero didn't take a commercial plane to Portland. Presumably he went by car. Fax every emergency room in the Portland area a description of the disease. Then hit every hospital along every freeway from San Jose to Portland.

dialogues.speaker: LISA ARONSON
dialogues.text: Right. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Drew Reyonlds sits down at Robby's desk. Suddenly he looks much older.

dialogues.speaker: DREW REYNOLDS
dialogues.text: We don't even have confirmation. This could all be for noth --

dialogues.speaker: ROBBY
dialogues.text: -- Worst first. My father never made the same mistake twice. Reynolds is humbled. Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corinne stands at Henry's bedside. She's getting sick too: pale, sweating, starting to cough, but she's more worried about Henry, who's barely conscious.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MASCELLI
dialogues.text: Henry, we got it early, and you're gonna make it. But I need you to fight. Henry stares at him with blank eyes.

dialogues.speaker: CORRINE
dialogues.text: Fight, Henry. Fight hard. The OVERHEAD PAGING SYSTEM GOES OFF.

dialogues.speaker: PAGING OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Dr. Mascelli, E.R. stat. Dr. Mascelli, E.R. stat... Dr. Mascelli rushes out. Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: EMERGENCY ROOM
dialogues.text: Two paramedics wheel in Tracy, the Movie Counter Sales-— girl with the spiked haircut. Her father runs alongside.

dialogues.speaker: TRACY'S FATHER
dialogues.text: Doc, she got sick so fast. I thought it was the flu, then she fainted in the bathroom. She's hot, Doc, so hot. HOLD ON Dr. Mascelli's fear, then -- Cut TO:  61.

dialogues.speaker: E.R. HALLWAY
dialogues.text: He's searching through a thick book on infectious diseases. Nurse Emma approaches, near tears:

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: What's wrong with these people?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MASCELLI
dialogues.text: I don't know. INTERCUT EMERGENCY ROOM - B.G. We see a roomful of people waiting to check in, including Mrs. Logan (the black woman with purple hair) and her toddler. Suddenly the toddler starts coughing and coughing. His lips turn blue.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LOGAN
dialogues.text: (screams ) My baby. My baby! Dr. Mascelli throws down the book and rushes out, past -- The FAX MACHINE, spitting out a sheet of paper. The words at the top declare: "Center for Disease Control, Atlanta, Emergency Bulletin." FADE UP the ROAR of a CHOPPER and -- Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: FT. DETRICK
dialogues.text: As the BELL CHOPPER emblazoned with the Boston Police logo hits ground, Gillespie, Berman, Salt and Owi yank open the doors and pull out the two shiny aluminum coffins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The aluminum coffins containing Jimbo Scott and Alice still lie open. Gillespie, Berman, and Owi anxiously watch Salt slip a slide under the scope and peer though the eyepieces. A long beat. He moves carefully from one field to the next.

dialogues.speaker: IZZY
dialogues.text: C'mon, for chrissakes. Salt shifts to another field, looks at it long and hard. Pulls his head back: hopelessness in his eyes. Cut TO:  62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fuzzy, bright fluorescent glow FILLS the SCREEN. As the image comes INTO FOCUS, we see the ugly, large red circles of Motaba.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shaken Bill Ford pulls back from his scope. He tries to project an air of calm:

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: P.C.R. tests are tricky. It's easy to make a mistake --

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: -- Yeah, I followed your orders instead of my gut. He grabs the phone and punches in a long distance number.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: I should've blasted our African findings across every newspaper in the country. (into phone) Robby.

dialogues.speaker: C.D.C. WAR ROOM
dialogues.text: One person after another sees her on the phone and real- izes what this is about. Within seconds the room is si- lent. Drew Reynolds squeezes his tennis ball. Robby's shoulders sag with dismay.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBY
dialogues.text: (into phone) You're sure? Reynolds drops the ball. Around the room: shock; even though they all anticipated the positive result, nobody can quite believe it.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: (into phone) You need my help, Robby. Robby, flustered, doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: I know this virus, you don't. I've worked this virus, you haven't. How many people are infected? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She's afraid to tell him.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: How many?

dialogues.speaker: ROBBY
dialogues.text: We don't know. We've only got a whole emergency room full of people in Bonneville, Oregon, and we don't know what they've got.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: (dismayed) How could that many people get infected so fast?

dialogues.speaker: ROBBY
dialogues.text: We're not sure.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Robby, don't get anywhere near this thing. Robby doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: You've been in an office for years. You've forgotten what these things are like.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBY
dialogues.text: I worked with the A.I.D.S. virus.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: That's level two, nothing! This is level four. Stay the fuck away, Robby.

dialogues.speaker: ON ROBBY
dialogues.text: She is scared.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Please, Robby. Stay away.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBY
dialogues.text: I need to be able to test a lot of people and quickly. I need the primer -- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs 64.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Why has it always been so hard for you to admit that you need anything from me?

dialogues.speaker: ROBBY
dialogues.text: I don't have time to fight with you. I'll have a courier pick up the primer at 01:00. up without giving him a chance to respond.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Robby! Hands trembling, he hangs up the phone. Ford says nothing, but in his eyes -- pity.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Request permission to bring my team to Bonneville, Oregon, sir.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Request denied. Civilian infections are not within our mandate --

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: -- A Presidential order can override --

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Let the C.D.C. do its job. If they need help, they know we're here.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: The Goddamn fuse is lit! What're you gonna do? Wait for the bomb to go off?

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: We don't live in the African bush. We don't crap in our streets, we don't drink dirty well water filled with spit. The disease will be stopped.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Yeah? Today, maybe they've got a handful... By tomorrow they could have a hundred, and the day after that, a thousand. When the President and Congress ask why you didn't bring in one group, the only group in the entire world with experience in fighting this disease, what're you gonna say? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: You don't obey orders, Gillespie. You're the last person I'd send.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: I'm sending a letter to the Surgeon General right now. I'm going to create a paper trail. You will fry. Gillespie storms out. Ford remains unruffled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gillespie bursts into the room and slams the door. He grabs the glass PAPERWEIGHT off his desk and throws it against the wall. It SHATTERS. He stops. A moment of hesitation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SERGEANT MUCIA picks up the phone. The wall clock reads midnight.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT MUCIA
dialogues.text: Fort Andrews. Air traffic control. Sergeant Mucia.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Sergeant, this is Colonel Gillespie at Fort Detrick. We're on code red status for Bonneville, Oregon. Time of departure 01:00.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT MUCIA
dialogues.text: That's not possible, sir.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Is that Mucia with a 'C' or an

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT MUCIA
dialogues.text: (nervous ) 'C,' sir. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Get it done, Sergeant. That's a direct oroder from General Ford.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT MUCIA
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flood lights illuminate dozens of enlisted men rapidly wheeling equipment into the open hatch of the huge C5A standing on the tarmac. Gillespie, Salt, and Berman approach the plane, Gillespie in the lead, the others two steps behind.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: The C.D.C. asked us? That doesn't sound like them.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: They're going to have to show the President they did everything possible. There's a nervousness in Izzy's face, something we've seen before.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Get a bunch of paper pushers scared enough, they'll do anything. Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He punches the words "Bonneville, Oregon" into his computer. The computer answers: "Population: 1218. Portland Metropolitan Area: Population: 532,000." He punches another key. A TELEPHONE speed dial WHISTLES across the room. Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gila monster hunts for prey, its eye darting back and forth, its tongue twitching hungrily. It runs off, vanishing in the dry chaparral and desert that stretches for hundreds of miles. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: We're seemingly in the middle of nowhere until we find -- An electrified barbed-wire fence emblazoned with signs warning: "U.S. Military Property: Trespassing Strictly Prohibited." Behind the fence stand rows of huge satellite scanners. Behind them are rows of duplexes. Inside one of the du- plexes a light comes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClintock grabs the PHONE RINGING by his bed.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: The genie's out of the bottle in Bonneville, Oregon, Donny, and we've got to get him back in. General McClintock looks dumb.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Cancel all leaves. Mobilize all personnel. I'm going to want wind conditions and transmission rates -- for all insects, animals, marine, and human vectors. If this virus is spreading, I want to know how fast and where. He looks at his computer monitor, which projects a map of Western Oregon: the town of Bonneville is close to the Columbia River.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Bonneville's only five miles from the Columbia River and if this mother gets there, we're in big shit trouble. Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. C5A
dialogues.text: Flying in heavey weather. COMPUTER KEYS POUND: September 3, 02:30. The Radioman turns to Gillespie, seated with Izzy and Salt in the back of the cockpit. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gillespie 68.

dialogues.speaker: RADIOMAN
dialogues.text: We've got the Secretary of Defense on the radio. They had to wake him up. unstraps himself and takes hold of the microphone.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: (into mike) Tell him it is Colonel Mike Gillespie, Commander of the U.S. Army Motaba Virus Task Force.

dialogues.speaker: LINED STUDY, (VIRGINIA)
dialogues.text: where PHILLIP GOODELL, the Secretary of Defense, is dressed in his pajamas.

dialogues.speaker: GOODELL
dialogues.text: Give that to me one more time, Colonel.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: We've got to quarantine the entire town of Bonneville and do it quick. Morning will be too late -- people will panic and try to leave. If even one infected person gets out, the entire effort could be for nothing.

dialogues.speaker: GOODELL
dialogues.text: Why can't the State Police do it?

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: They can shut down the major roads, but we need a much larger force to encircle the town.

dialogues.speaker: GOODELL
dialogues.text: Where would I get troops at this hour and have ‘em in Bonneville, Oregon before sunrise?

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Fort Lewis, Washington, or Ford Ord, California. Closer is better. Sir, this is a doomsday disease. (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: As deadly as A.I.D.S., but it kills within days. It could spread over the entire country. Goodell's wide awake now.

dialogues.speaker: GOODELL
dialogues.text: Does your commanding officer know about this?

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Yes, sir, of course. He asked me to call you.

dialogues.speaker: GOODELL
dialogues.text: Colonel, all I can do is refer the matter to the National Security Council. An action of this scope would require the President's approval.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Then get it, sir. Right away, please. They break radio contact. Salt looks at Gillespie with awe.

dialogues.speaker: IZZY
dialogues.text: If the C.D.C. asked us to help, why did you have to call the Defense Secretary? Why didn't General Ford make the call? Gillespie shifts uncomfortably. Salt realizes he's in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: IZZY
dialogues.text: You bet your ass, Captain. Colonel Gillespie has taken it upon himself to circumvent the entire chain of command. The plane bounces in the turbulence. Salt turns to Gillespie.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: You're shitting me?... Sir?

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: I'll take full responsibility for whatever happens. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: IZZY
dialogues.text: That only means they'll hang you first.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Don't worry, the C.D.C. -- and the President -- will invite us to Bonneville. (beat) They'll invite Mary and Jesus too.

dialogues.speaker: GOODELL
dialogues.text: (into phone) I just got a disturbing call from one of your officers, General.

dialogues.speaker: FORD IN HIS OFFICE
dialogues.text: sitting at his desk. As we hear Goodell go on, a look of anger builds on Ford's face.

dialogues.speaker: GOODELL
dialogues.text: I can tell the President we're looking at a situation you can contain with minimal loss of life, can't I?

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Of course. Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE'S BL-4 LAB
dialogues.text: TRACK PAST the open aluminum caskets holding the remains of Jimbo and Alice to Owi working under a negative pres-— sure hood. He removes a rack of test tubes, suddenly freezes. Facing him are General Ford and four men dressed in BL-4 suits and carrying automatic weapons in plastic sheaths. One soldier closes the caskets and starts moving them out The others start unpacking the freezers. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Owl Are you crazy? Don't touch them. Those are Level Four viruses. The lead soldier raises his rifle at Owi.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Sergeant, I want every specimen of Motaba Virus in this lab and this time no 'mistakes.' FADE UP COUNTRY MUSIC with a real twang like the JUDDS' "Red Cadillac" and... Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: RED PICKUP
dialogues.text: with chrome wheels racing along a deserted country road in the dark of night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOMMY HULL, 28, a construction worker, sings along. The windows of his pickup are wide open and the wind blows hi long hair straight back. There's an empty gun rack in the back. He rounds a turn and BRAKES to a SCREECHING HALT. The glare of flashing red and blue lights crosses his face.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: What the hell?

dialogues.speaker: THREE HIGHWAY PATROLMEN
dialogues.text: wearing gas masks and toting shotguns in their latex- gloved hands, stand in front of their patrol cars whose emergency lights flash off and on, creating an eerie glow. Down the road, is a second checkpoint where the patrol cars are facing the other way.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Tommy Hull climbs out. The HIGHWAY PATROLMAN raises his shotgun and aims it. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: What's goin' on?

dialogues.speaker: HIGHWAY PATROLMAN
dialogues.text: Stay inside your car. Tommy Hull freezes.

dialogues.speaker: HIGHWAY PATROLMAN
dialogues.text: Turn around, go home, and stay there.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: What's goin' on? Why are you wearin' all that stuff?

dialogues.speaker: HIGHWAY PATROLMAN
dialogues.text: Go home and you'll be all right. Move it. Tommy Hull ain't gonna argue with three loads of buckshot He STARTS his TRUCK, then stops and gapes, as rapidly ap- proaching from the opposite way towards town is...

dialogues.speaker: CONVOY OF THREE STATE POLICE CARS
dialogues.text: They ZOOM by him. In the back seat of the lead car, we see Robby and Lisa Aronson. Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The convoy of police cars pull in the parking lot where local police, wearing respirators, hold back a crowd of about twenty people, the families of those who are sick inside. Robby and Lisa and the state police officers climb out wearing their respirator/helmets and biosafety suits. The twenty people react as the realization sets in that what- ever their loved ones have, it's awful. Tracy's Father pushes forward.

dialogues.speaker: TRACY'S FATHER
dialogues.text: Nobody's tellin' us what's goin' on. Robby turns to the local POLICE CHIEF, Ray Fowler, a stringy, taciturn man. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: ROBBY
dialogues.text: I'm Dr. Roberta Keough from the C.D.C. I'm in charge.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE CHIEF
dialogues.text: I thought he was in charge. She follows his gaze to the main entrance of the hospital Standing at the top of the stairs, dressed in his bio- safety suit is...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Robby is shocked, but not shocked. She moves up the steps. He blocks her path.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: I've got people inside. They can do what needs to be done. Set up your command post outside the town, where you'll be safe. She tries to go around him. He grabs her arm.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBY
dialogues.text: (quietly) Let me do my job. Please. I know what I'm doing. A beat. He reluctantly lets go. She goes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robby, followed by Mike, moves down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBY
dialogues.text: On whose authority are you here, Michael?

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Want me to leave? She doesn't answer. We hear only the RUSH of AIR in their SUITS, drowning out the horror we see as they pass room after room of Motaba patients, screaming and moaning in pain. They pass... Izzy in a room with Henry, the lab tech. Lips blue, gasping for every breath, he fights against the vent- ilator. Streaks of blood line the wall. In the next bed is his girl friend, Corinne, comatose and near death. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A MOTHER'S cry of agony rips through the RUSH of AIR as Robby and Mike pass the room where Mrs. Logan is holding her dying toddler in her arms. Her body is covered with the fine red vesicular rash of end-stage Motaba. She pleads with Salt, standing there in a biosafety suit, completely helpless.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Save my baby... Please... Save my baby. Robby exchanges a glance with Gillespie. She's devastated.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: I tried to warn you. But nothing he could have said could have prepared her fo this. She moves on into...

dialogues.speaker: SMALL INTENSIVE CARE UNIT
dialogues.text: crammed with ten patients on gurneys, all sick with end- stage Motaba. Nurse Emma and Dr. Mascelli, in biosafety suits, pack Tracy, the movie-counter girl, in ice.

dialogues.speaker: TRACY
dialogues.text: (delirious with fever) Daddy... Daddy! Where's my daddy? Robby looks at Rudy, lying in the next cubicle, eyes com- pletely yellow and lifeless, face and body covered in black-and-blue splotches. His chest rises and falls in short gasps.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Bonneville patient zero. He never regained consciousness so we don't know how he got infected. Suddenly Tracy starts convulsing.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MASCELLI
dialogues.text: More Valium. Quick.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: We're out.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBY
dialogues.text: Where's the crash cart? (CONTINUED )

Nurse Emma nods to a Sears Roebuck-style tool cabinet in the corner. Dr. Mascelli starts for it, but Gillespie's already there He punches off the plastic lock, rips open a drawer and grabs a small box labeled Valium. He flips it to... Robby, who in a second, pops it open, pulls out the syringe of Valium and shoots the yellow liquid into Tracy's IV. She stops seizing. Dr. Mascelli and Nurse Emma are impressed.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBY
dialogues.text: Dr. Mascelli, we spoke on the phone, I'm Dr. Keough from the c.D.Cc. One of the patients starts coughing. Gillespie Robby are alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBY
dialogues.text: How many of your patients are coughing?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MASCELLI
dialogues.text: (indicating Rudy) Except for him, all of them. Why? and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a grid map of Bonneville with cases of Motaba marked in red. They're spread out all over the town.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MASCELLI
dialogues.text: The common bond is the movie theatre.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: This isn't the same virus --

dialogues.speaker: ROBBY
dialogues.text: -- It's mutated --

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: -- To an airborne form -- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DR. MASCELLI
dialogues.text: My God, if it's spreading through the air, person to person, by droplets, it's... it's the plague. Everybody in the town's gonna die.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: They may not all be infected.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MASCELLI
dialogues.text: But they will be. And if one person gets out --

dialogues.speaker: ROBBY
dialogues.text: The quarantine has to be ironclad --

dialogues.speaker: DR. MASCELLI
dialogues.text: People are gonna get out over the mountains -- it will be impossible to stop them.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: You're wrong. FADE UP the ROAR of CHOPPERS. An OVERWHELMING DIM. Dr. Macselli moves to the window, pulls back the shades. Can't believe his eyes. In the distance, against the dawn half-light... the sky i filled with Sikorsky Blackhawk helicopters from the U.S. Rapid Deployment Force.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBY
dialogues.text: (astonished) How...

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: -»-. Don't ask. Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A giant helicopter maneuvers a mobile BL-4 lab into the parking lot behind the hospital. Another chopper flies behind it, carrying a portable pre-fab hospital. Another sets down and begins disgorging combat troops wearing chem-warfare suits. Cut TO:  77.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIERS
dialogues.text: dressed in chemical warfare gear and carrying M-16s ride in a Jeep through the center of the town. The SOLDIER with a megaphone bellows at a group of townspeople gathered in front of a donut shop:

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Go home and stay there or you will be placed under arrest. The townspeople stare at these terrifying figures, then quickly disperse. REVEAL the next street over, and the next. Soldiers blast out warnings. Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY HULL, HIS WIFE, DARLA, AND TWO KIDS
dialogues.text: barreling along a gravel road in their pickup. In the hazy light, Tommy sees... Two infantry men in chem-war gear move into position on the road and raise their guns toward the pickup. Tommy does not slow down. His wife screams:

dialogues.speaker: DARLA
dialogues.text: They'll shoot us!!

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: They won't. But he can't be certain. The soldiers take aim. Tommy brings the PICKUP to a SCREECHING stop, throwing up gravel on all sides. He whips the vehicle around and heads back toward town. A Chinook HELICOPTER THUNDERS overhead. Tommy scans the horizon for an escape.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: I know one place they won't think to go. Cut TO:  78.

dialogues.speaker: RED PICKUP
dialogues.text: bouncing along an overgrown creek bed, splashing water everywhere, careening into the big rocks which litter the creek bed. Suddenly -- A helicopter gunship emerges over the tree-tops.

dialogues.speaker: DARLA
dialogues.text: Stop! But Tommy doesn't stop. The PICKUP keeps going -- SMASH- ING and BASHING its way up the creek. The GUNSHIP OPENS FIRE, shredding the tires. The PICKUP THUMPS to a halt. Inside, Darla and the children cry, Tommy is shaken. The helicopter hovers above them as the Hulls climb out and head back toward town. Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: STATE POLICE CAR
dialogues.text: coming to a fast stop at the highway checkpoint outside Bonneville as... GUNFIRE RINGS OUT from the distance. Inside, Mike and Robby react with alarm and climb out. CHOPPERS ROAR by overhead, create a DEAFENING BLAST. The line of cars trying to get out of town is a quarter mile long. They're held back by a... Long line of infantrymen in chem-war gear who look like futuristic insects. This area will become the front lines of a war. Robby and Mike race by the soldiers... To the command where LIEUTENANT COLONEL RONALD BRIGGS is on the radio, coordinating his units.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBY
dialogues.text: You're using rubber bullets, aren't you? Briggs salutes Gillespie. He speaks with a Georgia accent.

dialogues.speaker: LT. COLONEL BRIGGS
dialogues.text: No, ma'am. My orders are that no one is to get out of this town.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBY
dialogues.text: You're operating under civilian control in a civilian disater. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A monster Chinook comes down, sending up a torrent of dust.

dialogues.speaker: LT. COLONEL BRIGGS
dialogues.text: No, ma'am, we're not. He turns to... The figure emerging from under the WHIRLING BLADES: General Billy Ford. Gillespie braces himself. Robby's surprised. Billy hands Robby a sealed document.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: The Secretary of Defense and the President have made this a joint operation between the C.D.C. and the United States Army. I've been placed in command. Ford goes straight over to Gillespie. Briggs intercepts him halfway there, salutes, and reports:

dialogues.speaker: LT. COLONEL BRIGGS
dialogues.text: Sir, since we established our perimeter at 06:20, nobody has penetrated our line. Before that, I can give no guarantees.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: There are one thousand two hundred and eighteen people living in this town. I want every one of them accounted for by 09:00.

dialogues.speaker: LT. COLONEL BRIGGS
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. He moves off. Ford and Gillespie square off.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: You're under arrest. With Major Berman and Captain Salt --

dialogues.speaker: ROBBY
dialogues.text: -- He was right. We were wrong --

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: -- Stay out of it, Robby. Gillespie, you violated a direct order -- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: -- The virus is airborne.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Motaba is only spread by direct fluid contact.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Since it left Africa, it mutated.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: That's crazy.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Go to the hospital and see for yourself. Leave your face bare. Ford starts away from Gillespie.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBY
dialogues.text: You can't put him in jail. I need him. I need his whole team. Ford thinks for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Very well. Colonel, you, Major Berman, Captain Salt... can help Dr. Keough for the duration of this crisis, but you cannot leave this town and as soon as we get this under control, you'll be taken into custody.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Major Berman and Captain Salt were following my orders -- I am the only one at fault.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: We'll let the court martial decide that. Suddenly Robby's walkie-talkie squawks:

dialogues.speaker: LISA ARONSON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We got the host! FADE UP the cacophony of SHRIEKING ANIMALS and -- Cut TO:  81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The brown rhesus sits in the back of his cage, staring at Biosafety suited doctors crowded around his cage. The other ANIMALS SCREECH with hunger.

dialogues.speaker: LISA ARONSON
dialogues.text: I found this note on the desk... She holds a post-it with the words scribbled across it: "Scott - Monkey - 8/31."

dialogues.speaker: LISA ARONSON
dialogues.text: This must be the monkey Scott brought up from Biotest.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: And if he is the host, his blood will give us a treatment.

dialogues.speaker: LISA ARONSON
dialogues.text: He's so cute it's hard to believe he's caused such destruction.

dialogues.speaker: IZZY
dialogues.text: Hitler's girl friend used to say the same thing. Ford stands in the back of the room, disinterested, as if he knows already the brown rhesus is going to lead nowhere. Robby peers into the rhesus's cage.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBY
dialogues.text: Why is he so quiet?

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Monkeys get quiet when they get hungry...

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: «+. Or sick.

dialogues.speaker: -- SAN JOSE, CALIFORNIA"
dialogues.text: McClintock hurries down the long aisle filled with monkey cages stacked two high on both sides. Keeping pace is FELDER, the president of Bio-Test.

dialogues.speaker: FELDER
dialogues.text: These animals are all healthy. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: McClintock turns to a dozen biosafety-suited figures, each carrying a doctor's bag. McCLINTOCK Fan out. They each go off in a separate direction, leaving McClintock and Felder opposite a cage of African Green monkeys. McClintock opens his black bag, takes out a strange looking pistol and feeds in a cartridge con- taining a turquoise-blue liquid (amobarbital). McCLINTOCK One of these animals may be the host of the worst virus the world has ever known. Felder shudders. McClintock thunders into his walkie- talkie. McCLINTOCK Make sure the animals are completey tranquilized before specimens are drawn. Use all level four precautions. Felder squirms as McClintock aims the pistol at the Green MONKEY, who grabs the bars of the cage and HISSES. As one GUN after ANOTHER GOES OFF --

dialogues.speaker: HOSPITAL PARKING LOT
dialogues.text: ChemWar-suited infantrymen standing with M-16s held ready. Behind them is a pre-school with a yardful of toys now abandoned. The infantrymen stare at the brown rhesus, held tightly in a "squeeze cage." Robby, Mike, Lisa, and Wally look on anxiously as Izzy approaches the monkey with a needle attached to a long syringe. The rhesus strains with every muscle to lash out. Izzy moves quickly, jabbing the needle into the monkey's thigh. He pushes the plunger. The rhesus suddenly jerks his arm.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBY
dialogues.text: Izzy!

dialogues.speaker: NEEDLE HEADS FOR IZZY'S HAND, (SLOW MOTION)
dialogues.text: but he yanks it back just in time.  83.

dialogues.speaker: ON IZZY
dialogues.text: trembling. A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: The rhesus falls asleep. Izzy draws blood as a Jeep carrying Ford pulls up, followed by an Army truck. Soldiers empty the truck, piling up crates of plastic IV bags filled with brown fluid.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Filo-four antiserum. Antitoxin. Anyone with symptoms or positive blood tests will get it stat.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: It kills twenty-five percent of filoviruses.

dialogues.speaker: IZZY
dialogues.text: Not Motaba. We tried it.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: In the lab. People react differently. Gillespie and Izzy exchange a skeptical glance: is Ford losing it, or what?

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: We have nothing to lose -- the disease is incurable.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBY
dialogues.text: General Ford is right.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Thank you. Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: A) A school classroom, empty. B) A factory, empty. C) A supermarket, empty. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: D) The center of town -- Not a sign of life except for the Jeep carrying ChemWar troops bearing M-l6s.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The Army will begin emergency food deliveries once a day... Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHERRY listens to a RADIO with her three young children. She coughs and exchanges a worried look with her husband.

dialogues.speaker: WITH
dialogues.text: INT. LOCAL RADIO STATION - GLASSED-IN BROADCAST BOOTH -—

dialogues.speaker: ROBBY
dialogues.text: (into mike) ... If you have special needs, such as medicine you take, let them know and it'll be delivered to you. But please -- stay inside. Do not go out for any reason.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: (into mike) This disease looks like a regular flu in its early stages, but if you have flu symptoms, don't panic... It's probably just a normal virus and not Motaba.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (on radio) But the way to protect your family is to detect it early, before you spread it.

dialogues.speaker: ON SHERRY
dialogues.text: Terrified.  85.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRY'S HUSBAND
dialogues.text: You don't have it, honey.

dialogues.speaker: HER FOUR-YEAR-OLD SON
dialogues.text: What do you have, Mommy?

dialogues.speaker: SHERRY
dialogues.text: Nothing. Mommy's fine. Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford walks through the Motaba ward, now overflowing with infected patients, some of them unconscious and some of them moaning. Their loved ones have not been allowed into this infected ward, so most of these people are alone and scared. In Ford's eyes we see pain. From a RADIO in the nursing station.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (on radio) If you're feeling sick in any way, you should hang a pillowcase or other piece of cloth on your front door. Soldiers will take you somewhere safe for a test. You'll know the result within a few hours. If you're positive, you'll go into one of our isolation hospitals, so bring clothes and personal things you might need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darla and her two kids gather 'round the radio. In the b.g. Tommy takes a swig of whiskey. He's still trembling from his encounter with the chopper.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Turn it off!

dialogues.speaker: DARLA
dialogues.text: No. Tommy grabs the radio and throws it across the room, brea ing it. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: We don't have it, goddamn it. But if we stay here, we'll get it.

dialogues.speaker: DARLA
dialogues.text: They're doctors. They know more than you.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBY
dialogues.text: (into mike) I know you're scared. We're all scared. But together we're going to get through this. Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: BONNEVILLE GENERAL HOSPITAL
dialogues.text: A room full of Motaba patients, all with antiserum runnin through their IV's. Dr. Mascelli and Izzy listen to the RADIO. Mascelli's eyes are blood-shot. He sneezes and sniffles.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR MASCELLI
dialogues.text: And now I've got it too. I'm going to die along with the rest of them, aren't I? The look in Izzy's eyes confirms Dr. Mascelli's worst fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sherry slowly opens the front door, puts a white pillow- case over the door. Her kids run into her arms crying.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRY
dialogues.text: (hugging them) I'll be back in a few hours. It's like I'm goin' to work. She wipes the tears from her eyes; she's trembling. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: SHERRY
dialogues.text: (to each kid in turn) Now, promise you won't fight. Promise you'll do what your father tells you. They each promise - nodding "yes" in order from the oldest to the youngest. It's a very solemn moment as Sherry steps onto:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks slowly down the small path, knowing this could be the last time she ever makes this walk, ever sees her family. She stops, wipes a tear off her cheek. She wants to look back so bad, to get one last look at her kids, but doesn't want them to see her scared. She climbs into the waiting Army Jeep. Sherry waves as the Jeep pulls away. But she's sitting next to a soldier in full ChemWar gear, and this only amplifies the fear in her children's eyes. The Jeep drives past other houses with pillowcases over the door.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRY'S ARM
dialogues.text: Her fist clinches as Lisa Aronson finishes drawing blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa carefully slips the test tube of blood into a plexi- glass case and locks it. As she exits the tent, we see:

dialogues.speaker: TENT CITY
dialogues.text: Tent after tent -- at least four hundred of them -- a tent city set up on the high school football field. Housing people in isolation who have had or are about to undergo the blood test. This is purgatory, where you wait for judgment. Cut TO:  88.

dialogues.speaker: MOBILE BL-4 LAB
dialogues.text: Izzy carefully withdraws a syringe of clear liquid from a rubber capped bottle labeled "DNA PRIMER." He mixes this into a blood sample from a test patient. At the bench, Robby is doing the same. Izzy looks under his scope. The field is filled with red circles.

dialogues.speaker: IZZY
dialogues.text: Positive. He takes another tube of blood from a different patient. Looks under the scope.

dialogues.speaker: IZZY
dialogues.text: Positive. Robby looks under her scope.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBY
dialogues.text: Positive.

dialogues.speaker: IZZY
dialogues.text: The whole fucking town's infected. A sense of despair.

dialogues.speaker: IZZY
dialogues.text: Double check it! Triple check it. Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sherry Templeton tries to come to terms with the fact she's positive.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRY
dialogues.text: Does this mean my children have it, too?

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: (shaken by her pain) No... But she sees he's not sure.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRY
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: BL-4 LAB
dialogues.text: working. Izzy looking under the scope. Everything is purple.

dialogues.speaker: IZZY
dialogues.text: How can this be? Doctor Mascelli can't be negative. I know he's got it. Something's wrong. Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: BL-4 LAB
dialogues.text: Izzy concentrates on Mascelli's blood test. His eyes are bloodshot from fatigue.

dialogues.speaker: AIR HOSE COUPLING
dialogues.text: at Izzy's side. The red umbilical cord connected to the ceiling catches on the sink handle in the center island; it slowly slips out of its coupling and drops. The sound of RUSHING AIR suddenly STOPS.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: ... but Izzy doesn't hear it. He continues looking through the scope. Suddenly, he spots the red umbilical cord lying on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: IZZY
dialogues.text: No! Robby grabs the cord and re-inserts it into Izzy's suit; the RUSH OF AIR quickly fills the suit, but -- Izzy - panicked - runs out of the lab into:

dialogues.speaker: FORMALDEHYDE SHOWER AREA
dialogues.text: and blasts himself with formaldehyde. As the frothy liquid bath pours over him:

dialogues.speaker: IZZY'S FACE
dialogues.text: terrified: Did he breath in the virus? Cut TO:  90.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBY
dialogues.text: It was only a few seconds, nothing got in.

dialogues.speaker: IZZY
dialogues.text: I know. I'm fine. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBY
dialogues.text: I can finish the tests --

dialogues.speaker: IZZY
dialogues.text: -- I'm fine. She nods, worried. Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: HOSPITAL WARD
dialogues.text: Ford checks Henry's (the Lab Tech's) pulse. Nothing. He looks at McClintock, staring at Henry's corpse into which the antiserum is still flowing. In the next bed, Corinne, Henry's girl friend, also lies dead. McCLINTOCK The Motaba antiserum doesn't work.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: (devastated) The virus has changed enough so that the antibodies can't recognize it. We've got to find the host, Donny. McCLINTOCK How? The San Jose animals were all negative. (sharply) For thirty years you've thought it was a breath away. And we looked, and tested and tested. And we couldn't find it. (beat) What good would it do anyway? The virus has mutated. The host would carry the antibodies against the African strain -- before it mutated. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON Ford's 91.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Nature is more generous than man, Donny... it creates more variablity in the antibodies. If we find the host, its antibodies may be effective against the mutated strain. McCLINTOCK That's a guess. And there's no time, no cure. We have no choice but to implement the Emergency Containment Plan. troubled reaction -- Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: BL-4 LAB
dialogues.text: Gillespie, Robby, Lisa, and Izzy peer... Into the Brown Rhesus's cage. The monkey looks dreadful: he's crouched in a fetal position and his nose drips puss Gloom and

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: He's dying of Motaba. His blood doesn't have any protective antibodies. Nothing. defeat sink over the room.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBY
dialogues.text: But where did this monkey get the disease?

dialogues.speaker: LISA ARONSON
dialogues.text: Christ, it could have been anywhere... Maybe he was on a boat from Africa, next to the host.

dialogues.speaker: IZZY
dialogues.text: Then there's no hope.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: No. Unless Jimbo Scott had close contact with the host and that animal is somehow traceable. There's got to be something at Bio-Test. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: ROBBY
dialogues.text: Lisa, go back there. There's got to be something that was missed. Lisa nods. Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: BL-4 LAB
dialogues.text: Salt looks plaintively at the Rhesus. He opens the refrigerator and takes out a bottle labeled morphine. He's about to close the fridge, but stops and stares... Inside the refrigerator: a unit of antiserum just lying around. He looks at the antiserum, then at the monkey, sick in its cage. Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: QUARANTINE PERIMETER
dialogues.text: The line of troops and tanks stretches for miles. HUEYS THUNDER overhead, keeping watch. Behind the tanks are a swarm of figures wearing red BL-4 suits. They're moving cages filled with insects and animals toward a huge series of trailers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Command Center is buzzing with activity. Along one wall is an array of supercomputers all feeding data to... The big board -- a computerized map of the Quarantine Area. DR. FRANKLE, a Biowar Defense expert, an intense, bearded man of about 50 -- paces in front of the big board. As Frankle briefs Ford and McClintock, we literally see the epidemic spreading out from the center of Bonneville -- more and more terrain is colored red each time the big screen redraws. The red gets larger and larger, until it comes within three miles of the Columbia River, which cut a big blue swath through the map.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKLE
dialogues.text: Mosquitoes are picking up this virus. An hour ago a squirrel with Motaba was trapped just three miles from the river. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: (angry) Increase the spraying, Goddamnit!

dialogues.speaker: FRANKLE
dialogues.text: The best stuff we've got won't kill every last one. Eventually one bug, one animal's going to get through to the river. Worst case is the virus penetrates the ecosystem. Then we can't stop it.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: There's got to be a way to deal with it --

dialogues.speaker: FRANKLE
dialogues.text: -- The only similar case I know of is the Influenza Epidemic of 1918. It circled the globe in two weeks. Silence. McCLINTOCK People can be asymptomatic, for weeks. The tests are faulty. We have to assume everyone in this town is infected and will get this disease sooner or later. Silence. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: I want the most rapid-acting nerve gas. Something so quick they'll never know what hit ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The office is a small, chaotic room filled with old filin cabinets and ancient PC's. The company President, Felder, and Lisa Aronson sit near a speakerphone.

dialogues.speaker: LISA ARONSON
dialogues.text: (into phone) And I've been through all the files... No animal's been removed in the last fourteen days.

dialogues.speaker: FELDER
dialogues.text: If Jimbo Scott got an infected animal, he didn't get it here.

dialogues.speaker: SMALL OFFICE IN BACK OF BL-4 LAB
dialogues.text: Gillispie, Robby, and Izzy are running out of options as they converse with Lisa Aronson in San Jose, California, on the speakerphone:

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Could Jimbo Scott have deleated all traces of an animal stored at your facility?

dialogues.speaker: FELDER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Don't be absurd, he was a good employee --

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Mr. Felder, don't take this personally, but either you're a horrible judge of character or the world's in deep shit. Could Jimbo Scott have erased all records on an animal stored at your facility? Yes or no? Felder hesitates. Suddenly Gillespie's WALKIE-TALKIE BEEPS:

dialogues.speaker: SALT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Colonel, come quick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robby, Mike and Izzy enter the animal lab and stop cold. The brown rhesus is sitting up in his cage, weak but eating some lettuce.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: He should be dead. The last of the antiserum drips into the animal's arm.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: I gave him the antiserum.

dialogues.speaker: IZZY
dialogues.text: It doesn't work on people. It shouldn't work on simians either.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: So how come it worked on this one? Gillespie's mind is racing: (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: He was infected with the first strain, before it mutated.

dialogues.speaker: IZZY
dialogues.text: It still shouldn't work. This Korean Filo4 doesn't cross-react with the Motaba virus. We checked!

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Maybe it's not Korean Filo4.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: What else could it be? Izzy leans against the wall; he's pale, feverish. The others pay no attention.

dialogues.speaker: IZZY
dialogues.text: I need some air. He takes a step, then starts seizing, his whole body shaking in one convulsive wave after the next. Gillespie, Robby and Wally rush over.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: (checking his pulse) He's slowin' down. He's gonna arrest.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Let's go. Now! With extraordinary effort, he heaves Izzy over his back. Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: CROWDED MOTABA WARD
dialogues.text: Gillespie gently drops Izzy onto a hospital bed.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Ice, fluids, blood, oxygen... Let's go! Gillespie puts a probe in Berman's mouth, shudders when h sees the reading.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: A hundred and eight. Ice... I want ice... I mean now! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Wally runs in with ice, packs it around Berman's neck.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Open your eyes. Open your fuckin' eyes, Izzy. Nobody's lettin' you off so easy. Pressure?

dialogues.speaker: ROBBY
dialogues.text: Comin' up. A long, long beat. Berman slowly opens his eyes. Gillespie smiles.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: You were a hundred and eight. Not too long... but long enough... (an evil grin) You musta lost a billion brain cells.

dialogues.speaker: IZZY
dialogues.text: Now I'm only as smart as you. Gillespie grins. Berman tries to smile. His lip twitches... uncontrolla- bly. His whole body seizes.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: We need a line. Robby flips Gillespie a catheter set. He looks for a vein. Robby and Wally try to keep Izzy flat while Gillespie works, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Izzy's arm jerks free, pushing Mike's hand and the razor- sharp needle right at Mike's other hand.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBY
dialogues.text: Watch out! She shoves Mike's hand out of the path, but the needle nicks her glove. Mike and Wally are horrified.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Lemme see it. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: ROBBY
dialogues.text: (yanks her hand away) It didn't get past the outer glove. (to Wally) Hold him down. Wally pins Izzy's arm down as Robby sticks in an IV and injects medicine. Izzy stops seizing. Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robby, alone, peels back her triple-thick glove, and... The second layer is cut, too! She rips off the second layer and... The third layer is cut, too! She pulls it off to reveal: Her finger -- we see just the tiniest thin line of crimson blood. Terrified, she runs into...

dialogues.speaker: SURGICAL SCRUB ROOM
dialogues.text: and squeezes her finger, trying to expel any virus. She pours iodine into the tiny wound and frantically scrubs, as if her life depened on it. It does. She turns at the sound of the DOOR OPENING. It's Gillespie.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: (anguished) You took the hit for me... Why? Tears fill her eyes. Her mouth opens. She can't talk. Only a low moan of terror. Gillespie cradles her head against his. Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: PROP PLANE
dialogues.text: spraying over the forest outside Bonneville. Huge wafts of smoke drift over the birch and pine forest like a thick fog. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Hidden in the dense woods, Tommy Hull takes a slug of whisky and watches the plane. Between him and the plane are Armed Personnel carriers, their gas-masked personnel unaffected by the poison. Tommy coughs. He stands up on the hood of an old blue van and screams at the troops.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: That's right. Kill us all. C'mon! They can't hear him or see him. He finishes the last of the bottle and climbs into...

dialogues.speaker: HIS BEAT-UP VAN
dialogues.text: We see on the floor a half dozen guns including a shotgun and an AK-47. He STARTS the ENGINE and ROARS off. Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: CHECKPOINT GUARD
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Colonel. You can't proceed. Gillespie's Jeep is blocked by THREE GUARDS armed with M-1l6s.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Get the hell out of my way. I'm going to see the General.

dialogues.speaker: CHECKPOINT GUARD
dialogues.text: Strict orders, sir. Anyone with direct patient care is contaminated.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: That's a load of crap. Get him on the line, soldier. Now!

dialogues.speaker: CHECKPOINT GUARD
dialogues.text: (punches on the radio) Checkpoint three to base. Colonel Gillespie to speak to General Ford. Suddenly, Tommy Hull drives up and brakes to a stop. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CHECKPOINT GUARD
dialogues.text: Go home.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: You go home. Before Guard #2 can react, Hull raises his SHOTGUN and FIRES. Gillespie dives under the dashboard of his Jeep. The other Guards react. Too late. Tommy Hull pulls an AK-47 out from behind his seat and CHEWS them UP. The RADIO BLASTS:

dialogues.speaker: RADIO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Base to checkpoint three: what's goin' on? Tommy Hull FIRES the SHOTGUN again, ANNIHILATING the RADIO. He ROARS ahead. Gillespie races over to soldiers. They're dead. He looks at... The van, racing toward the crest of the hill. Suddenly, from the other side of the hill: Two Apache helicopters appear. Hull sticks the AK-47 out the window and FIRES at the choppers. They keep coming. Red sparks erupt from their bellies. HELLFIRES. The VAN EXPLODES into tiny pieces. Gillespie GUNS the JEEP toward the wreckage. A Jeep driven by General Ford comes over the hill and pulls up on...

dialogues.speaker: OPPOSITE SIDE OF WRECKAGE
dialogues.text: Ford and Gillespie both survey the charred remains of the van. Both are appalled. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford says 100.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: You had the antiserum to the original African strain, you could've made it available right away. The virus would've never had a chance to mutate. You could have stopped this whole epidemic before it got started. Why? nothing. He stares at the wreckage as if some- how he could find an answer there he himself believes. Silence. Silence. Then with

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Why? Finally:

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: It's so strange... You look at these viruses under the electron microscope... They're like... like beautiful symmetrical crystals, so cold, so pure. You think you're looking at some fabulous piece of sculpture behind a museum wall... till you see the blood and people dying all around you. I stopped it once. I thought I could stop it again.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: You ordered the attack on Iwabi's people in Africa? Ford neither confirms nor denies the accusation. sadness and remorse, Ford tells the truth:

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: We had to ensure that we had the only live samples of the virus.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Biowarfare research is illegal. We signed a treaty...

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: ... What do you know about the real world, Gillespie? Even the air you breathe is artificial. Why do you think Saddam Hussein didn't kill our boys with his anthrax and his botulism and all the other crap he created in his labs? 'Cause he knew we had something worse -- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gillespie, begins to 101.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: -- One mad man --

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: -- Every fucking dictator of the future's going to use biological weapons that you can manufacture cheap in a test tube with technology you can buy at the newsrack. Deterrence works. horrified, steps away from his boss as he understand the scope of the deception which he has been the victim of.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: We spent years synthesizing an antibody that worked with the original African strain. We assumed it would work with this Bonneville strain. We gambled. We lost. We can't afford to lose again...

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: So you're going to wipe out this entire town -- kill everyone in it?

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: The virus is going to reach the river.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Take the people who are well and get them out!

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: If even one were sick, no matter where we were, the disease would start again. Beat, Gillespie knows he's right.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Your only hope is to look for the host.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: I did -- for thirty years.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Let me. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: You might be contaminated.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: I know I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: We have facilites to hold a few people in quarantine. Get out now. Take your team.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Izzy is sick, Robby infected. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Wipe out the town, wipe out Motaba. And you're still the only one in the world who's got the virus. No Matter what, your program's secure.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: That's not a consideration.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Bullshit! Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: BL-4 LAB
dialogues.text: Pages spit out of the fax. As WALLY gathers them up, we see the cover page:

dialogues.speaker: COVER PAGE
dialogues.text: From: Lisa Aronson, M.D. To: Colonel Gillespie, M.D. RE: Biotest Animal Inventory Mike -- Here is the list of every animal imported by Biotest during the last six months...

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Salt looks outside, worried:  103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Black Hawk helicopter takes off. Soldiers gather around a second Black Hawk and start to load their gear. The BioWar Defense Unit is pulling out of the town.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: HOLD on Salt's face: scared. Robby has as yet no sign of the fever. She and Gillespie pour over the fax from Lisa Aronson.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: Colonel, we gotta go now. Beat. Mike and Robby exchange a glance, knowing this may be the last time they're together.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBY
dialogues.text: No goodbyes. It's bad luck.

dialogues.speaker: ON GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: desperately torn, not wanting to leave her.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBY
dialogues.text: I'm glad you were here. Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salt carries a decontamination unit on his back, Gillespie a cellular phone and a black duffel bag as they reach --

dialogues.speaker: BLACK HAWK
dialogues.text: Where soldiers finish loading under the watchful eye of SERGEANT MEYER.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT MEYER
dialogues.text: Atten-shun! The soldiers salute Gillespie and Salt.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Sergeant, General Ford has ordered us to decon all aircraft before takeoff. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT MEYER
dialogues.text: But we've been doing it at the base, sir.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Vector transmission is increasing and airborne contamination must be minimized. Pretty soon, Sergeant, even that suit won't protect you.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT MEYER
dialogues.text: (scared) Yes, sir. Salt takes hold of Sergeant Meyer's walkie-talkie. The Sergeant is puzzled by this but says nothing as Salt sprays it thoroughly with disinfectant before handing it back. He sprays the outside of the chopper, then moves inside.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT MEYER
dialogues.text: The pilot is inside, sir!

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: I'll get him out. Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE CHOPPER
dialogues.text: Sergeant Meyer reacts as the big rotor blades start to turn. The chopper begins to rise:

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT MEYER
dialogues.text: What the hell? Sergeant Meyer reaches for his walkie-talkie, but it won't work. He slams it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pilot, WARRANT OFFICER DETERICH barks into his radio:

dialogues.speaker: WARRANT OFFICER DETERICH
dialogues.text: Den mother, this is Naked Zulu. Going to decon.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Roger, that, Naked Zulu. PULL BACK to reveal Gillespie holding a gun against Deterich's head. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Nice and easy now. The Black Hawk cruises over the camp, blending right in with half-a-dozen other choppers going in all directions. Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: COMMAND CENTER
dialogues.text: Sergeant Meyer stands nervously at attention, trying to avoid the eyes of General McClintock, who's fit to be tied. In a rapidly moving DOLLY SHOT, McClintock leaves Meyer and approaches General Ford, who is on the phone. McCLINTOCK Your Colonel Gillespie has commandeered one of our helicopters.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Just the hint of astonishment. Then he regains his usual composure: McCLINTOCK Gillespie has become a vector of the disease. Mobilize all resources to find him. Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warrant Officer Deterich, dressed in underwear, huddles against a huge rock. A pile of rations lie beside him.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: There's food and water for two days. They'll find you by then. Gillespie slips on Deterich's uniform, Salt pulls on Gillespie's.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: You never expected to make Colonel this fast, did you, Salt? Cut TO:  106.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. BLACK HAWK
dialogues.text: Hovering above Deterich. Salt opens the throttle; the CHOPPER ROARS down the coast and Deterich becomes nothing but a dot in a cove shut off by soaring cliffs on one side and the ocean on the other. Salt keeps the chopper just feet above the whitecaps.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Not bad for somebody who hasn't flown in six years.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Seven. Want to see my loop-d- loop? He pulls the wheel, brining the nose up to a high angle of attack. Gillespie looks panicked. Salt levels out the chopper.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Just kidding, sir. Gillespie studies the air map of the Pacific Ocean.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Cut inland at Klamath River and keep this mountain ridge between us and Oregon.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: To San Jose, sir?

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: No. Ford will anticipate that.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Lisa Aronson sent us all the shipping records...

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: No, not all... Just the ones Biotest had. COMPUTER KEYS POUND.

dialogues.speaker: TWO F-15 EAGLES
dialogues.text: SCREAM down the runway and lift off. Within seconds, more follow.  107.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClintock's Apache sweeps above the forest. The radar screen indicates a return. McClintock picks up the radio: McCLINTOCK Portland regional, please identify transponder 2CAW442. Over.

dialogues.speaker: TRAFFIC CONTROLLER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That's another light plane, number 86221 Zebra, registered Corvallis... McClintock grimaces. McCLINTOCK Where the hell's that A.W.A.C.S.?

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: Sir, they're comin' from Oklahoma. The radio crackles:

dialogues.speaker: F-15 PILOT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Got a low target sitting on the coast. Going down for visual.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BLACK HAWK HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Where Salt sees a blip on the radar screen.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Problems. He pushes the wheel down, and the camouflaged-painted chopper descends into a tight ravine between two rocks. The blades whirl inches from disaster. Gillespie holds his breath; so does Salt who tries to hold the Black Hawk motionless. We hear a SONIC BOOM. The F-15 streaks overhead. Gillespie and Salt exchange a glance. Have they been seen or not?

dialogues.speaker: F-15 PILOT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I've lost it. Possible bird flock. The plane turns inland. Gillespie and Salt breathe again.  108. INT. McCLINTOCK'S APACHE McCLINTOCK (into radio) General, Gillespie could now be anywhere inside a thousand mile radius, and if he's landed, we got no way to track him. INTERCUT the Command Center. Ford is angry and frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: You're Gillespie, you don't trust the C.D.C., you don't trust anybody... you'd want to look at all the data yourself. Ford turns to an aide, Lieutenant Richardson:

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Issue an all-points bulletin to every police department on the West Coast. Start with San Jose. Colonel Gillespie and Captain Salt are armed, and assumed to be contaminated until proven otherwise... Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: FAX MACHINE
dialogues.text: Photos of Gillespie and Salt roll into the reader, then -- Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is pouring RAIN. At first, everything looks normal. Until we realize there aren't any people on the side- walks. And no moving cars on the streets. Snipers with .22 rifles and telescopic sights straddle the rooftops.

dialogues.speaker: FEDERAL BUILDING
dialogues.text: A long line of people wait for a single clerk; it's lunch hour. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Gillespie storms in and goes right to the front of the line. The others glare. The clerk, ARMISTEAD, a 50-ish man with long grey hair tied in a pony tail, continues to help the lady in the front of the line.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: (sharply) Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: ARMISTEAD
dialogues.text: Just a minute, soldier. He continues helping the lady.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: I am Warrant Officer Deterich of the United States Army -- The NEXT PERSON in line reacts:

dialogues.speaker: NEXT PERSON
dialogues.text: Hey -- end of the line, asshole --

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: I just came from the site of the virus epidemic in Oregon and you will help me now! Armistead's supervisor, MRS. PANAMIDES, comes out of her office as the other persons waiting in line, fearful of the dreaded Motaba Virus, edge away from Gillespie rapidly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you need?

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Bills of lading for all ships which arrived from Africa during the last six months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you looking for?

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: An animal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of animal. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: I don't know. Cut TO:  110.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shaggy, sloppily dressed COMPUTER JOCK types.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER JOCK
dialogues.text: Biotest is very methodical about their paper work. The printer spits out pages of animals. Gillespie cross- checks them against the fax pages from Lisa. They match perfectly.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER JOCK
dialogues.text: That's it. Sorry. Gillespie leans back: In despair. Not sure what to do next. A long beat. The Computer Jock walks over to the printer.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER JOCK
dialogues.text: Damn! Jammed again! He hits a reset button. One more page prints out. At the top of the page: An entry that Lisa's list doesn't have. Gillespie circles it in red.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: That's it. The Apeldoorn, a Dutch freighter. One monkey. But what kind of monkey?

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER JOCK
dialogues.text: There's no way to tell. Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: climbing into the Black Hawk. The RAIN is much heavier now. Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as it rises off the rooftop of the Federal Building. From this vantage, Gillespie and Salt can see a threat-— ening rain storm sweeping in over the San Francisco Bay. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: I tried to radio. All static. ‘Cause of the storm.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: So ‘cause of the storm, you want me to fly twenty miles through a gale and hover while I drop you on board a ship at sea?

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Sir, with all respect -- no fuckin' chance. Beat. Gillespie is dead serious.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: The storm won't break 'til tomorrow. Salt is torn.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: If you want, I could try to hover and drop you on board.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: No way. Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: PACIFIC OCEAN
dialogues.text: The chopper fighting the gale, trying to find the ship in the storm. The sky is so dark it's like night. RAIN POUNDS the windshield; the wipers can't keep up.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Colonel, I couldn't find my umbrella in this rain. Despair. A long beat. Then: In the distance through the mist, a red light flashes. Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: BLACK HAWK
dialogues.text: hovering above the Apeldoorn, riding rough on twenty- foot swells. The winds rock the chopper. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Wally fights to hold it steady.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Ready for drop.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Speak for yourself. On the deck of the Apeldoorn: Four crewmen hold tight onto their lifelines and wait for -- Gillespie, who emerges from the belly of the chopper. He hangs tight onto the winch, which strains in the wind, thrusting Gillespie over the waves. One breaks on top of him. A crewman grabs the line with a hook and reels Gillespie in.

dialogues.speaker: FREEZER DOOR
dialogues.text: opening. Gillespie isn't ready for this: Frozen on a shelf, is Seaman Dieter Jans. Even under a layer of ice, the yellow skin, blood streaking from his nipples, and other signs of Motaba are all too clear.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: How long has it been since the monkey was on the ship? One of the seamen translates Gillespie's question to the CAPTAIN in Dutch. The Captain answers in halting English:

dialogues.speaker: DUTCH CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: How long? Six days.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: When did Seaman Jans first get sick?

dialogues.speaker: DUTCH CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Yesterday -- he is sick yesterday night. He is dead early this morning.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: alarmed. This is ominous information. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Captain, your ship will have to be quarantined at sea. No one is to go near this freezer. Do you understand? The Captain nods, overwhelmed by sudden fear.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Someone else must have seen the monkey -- The First Mate steps forward. As he begins to jabber in Dutch...

dialogues.speaker: BLACK HAWK
dialogues.text: racing back to shore. Gillespie's on the cellular PHONE. The storm fills the line with STATIC.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: The monkey was small, black and white... COMPUTER KEYS POUND: KINSHASA NATIONAL HOSPITAL, ZAIRE.

dialogues.speaker: DR. IWABI
dialogues.text: (into phone) A colobos monkey. The highways have chased them deeper and deeper into the jungle. But there are still a few left.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Find as many as you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the phone. Drew Reynolds listens with rapt attention.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (into phone) -- But you have to help me -- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: REYNOLDS
dialogues.text: (into phone) -- I will do whatever they let me do...

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (desperately) If they implement the containment plan -- Reynolds is angry, flustered -- terrified his worst nightmare has come a reality.

dialogues.speaker: REYNOLDS
dialogues.text: It's out of my hands!

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: If we can find the host, we can obtain an effective antibody against the virus, and reproduce it. We can present them with a credible alternative... Reynolds squeezes his tennis ball.

dialogues.speaker: REYNOLDS
dialogues.text: My people have been doing everything humanly possible to help.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Drew, Robby's infected. Reynolds squeezes his tennis ball tighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four and five-year-olds play happily in a sandbox outside their pre-school which borders the Columbia National Forest. Their teacher, MRS. JEFFRIES, carefully watches over them. Betsy hides behind a nearby tree. She's hungry and can't take her eyes off the half-eaten sandwiches lying in the kids' snack boxes. Sean is distracted by a glimpse of Betsy and spills his juice all over Geneva. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: GENEVA
dialogues.text: You dodohead. (breaking into tears) Mrs. Jeffries, look what Sean did.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: I didn't... mean to!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. JEFFRIES
dialogues.text: (taking her by the hand) We'll clean you up right away. (heads inside) The rest of you come in, too. 115. All the children follow her except Sean, pouting. Betsy runs up and starts gobbling a sandwich. Se the monkey, then moves toward her:

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Hey, that's mine! BETSY HISSES. Sean, scared, runs.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: A monkey stole my sandwich. He points to the sandbox but there's no tra Mrs. Jeffries kneels.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. JEFFRIES
dialogues.text: There are no monkeys in this forest, Sean. It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Frankle paces nervously.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FRANKLE
dialogues.text: The storm's blowin' up the coast faster than we thought. That's a problem. The wind's going to hasten vector transmission and the rain's going to absorb the gas. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: an stares at ce of Betsy. Cut TO: (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DR. FRANKLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, Colonel, you'd have to hit the town two, three times to be sure you got everybody. The thought of this troubles Ford deeply.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: What time's that storm going to hit? Frankle wavers.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Goddammnit, you got every computer in the world here, what time's it comin'?

dialogues.speaker: DR. FRANKLE
dialogues.text: Any time before dawn you should be okay.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Then we go at midnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the pouring RAIN, the Black Hawk carrying Gillespie and Salt lands on the helipad next to the television station: WNER.

dialogues.speaker: ON NEWSROOM SOUNDSTAGE
dialogues.text: The ANCHORMAN looks grim:

dialogues.speaker: ANCHORMAN
dialogues.text: The governor of Oregon this morning extended the evacuation zone another five miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The security guard watches the NEWSCAST: The governor of Oregon is giving a press conference. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: GOVERNOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (on T.V.) General Ford and the Army physicians have assured me there is no threat of spread of this disease at the present time. This is strictly a precautionary measure...

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER FROM FLOOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (on T.V.) Why have all communications in and out of Bonneville been cut off?

dialogues.speaker: GOVERNOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (on T.V.) There is apparently some kind of computer malfunction in that area... The guard suddenly freezes. Salt and Gillespie burst inside holding M-1l6s.

dialogues.speaker: ANCHORMAN
dialogues.text: In a related story, the Army has released the names of two men who escaped from Bonneville and are infected with this virus. The pictures of Gillespie and Salt fill the screen. Suddenly there's a RUCKUS O.S. and the Anchorman gasps as the security guard, hands held high, moves toward the news desk.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Nobody move! Gillespie sits down beside the Anchor. He shrinks back as Gillespie leans over, grabs his lapel mike and pins it on himself.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: I am not infected. One of the two cameramen backs away from his camera and bolts toward the door. Salt points the gun at him, but doesn't pull the trigger. More and more people stampede out. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Shake it, Colonel! Gillespie talks into the camera with the red light on.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: We need help to find the animal carrying the Motaba Virus. It is a small black and white monkey and it was brought to Northern California or Oregon within the last two weeks. If you have any information about this monkey, please call this number at the c.D.Cc. in Atlanta. He holds up a crude sign with the numbers

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Many people are going to die. This is their only chance. Please... Help us... Gillespie bolts up. He and Salt run out of the newsroom. FADE UP POLICE SIRENS and -- Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: pull up to the station, but -- The Black Hawk is half a mile away, running full- throttle. The OFFICER in the lead car grabs his radio.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: (into radio) Suspects heading northwest... Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford and McClintock watch Bernard Shaw on CNN. Behind them we see the computerized map of the quarantine area. The red perimeter is within one mile of the Columbia River. The clock reads: 17:12. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD SHAW, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (on T.V) Colonel Gillespie's action -- commandeering this news room at a California television station in order to get his message out -- raises troubling questions about what is really going on inside the quarantine area. McCLINTOCK Great, now we've got the whole fucking world watching. You should've locked him up when we got here. People'll be calling Washington... The President won't be able to make up his mind, and the whole fucking planet will go. Outside, it's starting to SPRINKLE. Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: PRE-SCHOOL CLASSROOM, (MOLALLA, OREGON)
dialogues.text: Empty except for Mrs. Jeffries who's cleaning up. A pile of paintings. One is of an enormous black and white monkey towering menacingly over a little stick figure. Mrs. Jeffries smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other staff idly watching the NEWS. Mrs. Jeffries enters and grabs a cup of coffee. On TV, we see the face of Mike Gillespie, and we hear the tail end of his plea:

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (on T.V.) If you have any information about this monkey, please call... HOLD ON Mrs. Jeffries' face.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK HAWK, (POURING RAIN)
dialogues.text: flying low over the redwoods of Northern California. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Gillespie clicks off the phone. Salt is dumbfounded:

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: I'm gonna fly into the heaviest radar surveillance on Earth on account of something that might have been seen by a toddler?

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: We know that Jimbo Scott took an animal up to Bonneville to sell. This place, Molalla, would be right on the way to the airport. Gillespie studies the map.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: To get back up there we're gonna haveta fly through everything the Air Force has got. Are you feelin' lucky, Captain?

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Luck ain't gonna be enough. Salt pushes the wheel down, until the Black Hawk is just a few feet above the tall redwood trees. He veers to avoid -- A particularly tall redwood -- and misses it by inches, whacking off a few of its upper branches with the rotor blades.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: ‘Course -- a little luck won't hurt us any. He and Gillespie exchange a tense, worried glance. That was close. As the chopper skims low over the redwoods -- Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: AWACS PLANE, (AT 10,000 FEET)
