dialogues.text: cruising high above the clouds which now blanket the terrain below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside, the RADAR OPERATORS scan. They're pissed. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: RADAR OPERATOR
dialogues.text: Where the hell did it go? Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: BLACK HAWK, (DIRECTLY BELOW ON INTERSTATE 5)
dialogues.text: flies just thirty feet above the freeway, at the same speed as the traffic. The Black Hawk's RADAR DETECTOR SQUAWKS each time the AWACS radar scans it, every two seconds.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BLACK HAWK
dialogues.text: Salt flies anxiously. One moment of inattention could bring the Black Hawk down on top of one of the cars on the freeway.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: It moves like a truck, it reflects radar like a truck, but guess what? It ain't a truck.

dialogues.speaker: ON INTERSTATE BELOW BLACK HAWK
dialogues.text: An IRATE DRIVER is watching Salt and yelling into his cellular phone:

dialogues.speaker: IRATE DRIVER
dialogues.text: That's right, Sheriff -- flying too Goddamn low --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: We got him! McClintock smiles, grabs his flight helmet and races --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His squadron of Apaches takes off. A FAX MACHINE WHINES O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford scans the fax. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The other officers in the room grow silent as they see his face grow grim and serious.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, I have in my hand the final authorization to proceed, signed by the President. I know that each of us has doubts about what we are about to do. It is only human to have doubts when you are commanded to take the lives of other human beings. Remember your wives, remember your children... they will all get the disease and die if we let fear govern our hearts. We are doing what is right, and what the nation requires of us. PAN ACROSS the grim faces.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: I expect each man to do his duty. I know you won't fail. Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: BLACK HAWK
dialogues.text: Gillespie standing beside the open door aiming an infrared heat-sensing device down at the forest which is so thick with trees you can only rarely catch glimpses of the forest floor.

dialogues.speaker: ON COMPUTER MONITOR
dialogues.text: Swirls of colors -- like gases moving on the surface of the sun -- diffuse across the screen. Gradually, we see that one bright red band is moving faster than the others.

dialogues.speaker: SALT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: The monkey!

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: No, it's moving too fast.

dialogues.speaker: FOREST BELOW
dialogues.text: A deer scurries across a clearing.  123.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DISCOVER Betsy: Only a few hundred feet away from the deer. Afraid of man and his loud machines, she runs deeper into the forest, hiding herself under the branches of trees.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: picks up another swirl of red on the infra-red sensing device. He points to it.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Circle in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OPEN WIDE to show the chopper moving in a tight circle.

dialogues.speaker: BETSY
dialogues.text: hearing the ROAR of the CHOPPER LOUDER AND LOUDER, scurries up a tree and tries to hide.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: stares at the monitor. A faint red band appears in the corner of the screen, then disappears.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Starboard! The chopper veers to the right and the red band glows brighter and brighter.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Lock! The chopper hovers, then starts to descend straight down. Gillespie looks through binoculars at:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing but trees... trees... more trees... Stop! A patch of black and white. A pair of frightened eyes. Betsy hisses at the terrifying monster.  124.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: Drive her down! She falls from that height, she'll bleed out. Gillespie jams cartridges containing turquoise liquid into the M-16. He FIRES. The bullets land above Betsy. She jumps onto a lower branch. The bullets keep coming. She jumps onto:

dialogues.speaker: ON GROUND
dialogues.text: Gillespie FIRES. Misses. The blue liquid splatters against a tree trunk.

dialogues.speaker: BETSY
dialogues.text: caught in the open, darts toward a thick patch of trees - safety. She's only a step away.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: FIRES again.

dialogues.speaker: BETSY
dialogues.text: Betsy's hit. She spins, grabbing her arm in pain, then gets up. Tries to make it to the next tree. Goes down on one knee. Then the other. She reaches out. Cries for freedom. Then collapses. As Gillespie lowers himself out the door -- Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: HORIZON
dialogues.text: The Apaches approaching fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gillespie stows Betsy in the back. Salt sees the glistening lights of the Apaches.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Up! Fast! Salt yanks the wheel back. The Black Hawk starts climbing. The Apaches quickly surround it. INTERCUT:  125.

dialogues.speaker: COMMAND CENTER
dialogues.text: on a radar screen, Ford can see Gillespie's chopper and t Apaches. He and Gillespie and McClintock converse through their radios:

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Give me the monkey, Mike. The Black Hawk climbs higher and higher, through the thic layer of clouds, now absolutely black in the darkness of the night.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: If the antibodies work, we'd have a way to stop the epidemic by medical means --

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: -- We have no way to produce them in quantity --

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: -- Dr. Iwabi --

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: There's no time for that now. In the lead Apache, snipers lean out the window. Their telescopic sights lock on Gillespie and Salt. McCLINTOCK Give me an order to fire, sir. We don't need the monkey.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: You do. Because if you fail to contain the virus, you're going to be racing to synthesize an antiserum. How long did it take you to do the last one? A year? Two years? Five? Ford's torn.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: If the monkey's antibody is effective, you could use it as a template. Maybe you could save Europe. Ford hesitates. McCLINTOCK Sir, let me -- The Black Hawk blasts through the cloud cover and emerges  126.

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE CLOUDS
dialogues.text: A full moon illuminates the Black Hawk. The Apaches burst through the clouds, too.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Fire away! Nothing's going to survive the crash.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: a long beat. Gillespie's got him.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: You've got until midnight, Mike. Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: FOREST SURROUNDING TOWN
dialogues.text: The forest looks dark and primeval in the damp night. The sounds of BIRD CALLS and CRICKETS CHIRPING can be heard i the background. This is what a biological meltdown looks like -- nothing at all. Then suddenly a deer drops to its knees, stricken with the Motaba Virus. It struggles to rise, but fails. The deer keels over, barely breathing. Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE QUARANTINE PERIMETER
dialogues.text: Large canisters of deadly nerve gas are loaded onto Chinook helicopters. The canisters are clearly marked with the skull-and-crossbones for "poison" and big red "CAUTION!" labels. Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: HOSPITAL HELIPORT
dialogues.text: settling down. Cut TO:  127.

dialogues.speaker: HOSPITAL LAB
dialogues.text: Tubes run from Betsy to a blood separator as Salt works feverishly to separate the antibodies out. As the centrifuge spins faster and faster -- Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: HOSPITAL CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: moving rapidly past the patients 'til he gets to:

dialogues.speaker: IZZY'S ROOM
dialogues.text: Gillespie's alarmed. Izzy looks terrible, his voice a whisper:

dialogues.speaker: IZZY BERMAN
dialogues.text: Mike... I know you never liked my name.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: IZZY BERMAN
dialogues.text: My nickname -- Izzy. You never really liked it.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: I like it all right.

dialogues.speaker: IZZY
dialogues.text: (smiles) It's okay, 'cause from now on you can call me Hurricane.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: (smiles) I like it.

dialogues.speaker: IZZY
dialogues.text: Good, ‘cause I'm giving you a new name, too. Guess what it is? Izzy's lips go dusky, his breathing only short gasps.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Tell me.

dialogues.speaker: IZZY
dialogues.text: Guess. Gillespie's voice breaks: (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: I can't. Izzy's dead. Tears stream down Gillespie's cheeks. Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: ROBBY'S ROOM
dialogues.text: She's lying in a bed, her face flush with fever, her skin covered with the rash. She's just barely conscious enough to see him at the door, watching her.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBY
dialogues.text: I'm scared. So scared. He comes toward her.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBY
dialogues.text: No false hope. No games.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: You can't give up.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBY
dialogues.text: Just be with me. He cups her hands in his gloved hand.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBY
dialogues.text: How's Izzy?

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: He's gonna be okay. You're both going to be okay. Her eyes start to close. Gillespie, horrified, shakes her:

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Stay with me! Fight! She half opens her eyes, her voice a murmur.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBY
dialogues.text: Hold... me. He puts his arms around her. Screams into helmet radio:

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Salt, where the hell are you? Salt, answer me! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: No response. A long beat. Then Gillespie... with more tenderness than we've ever seen:

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Remember the first time we made love? In France. Behind the haystack. And we were so worried that the little boy on the bicycle might see us. She smiles, remembering.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: I never felt anything except with you, Robby. I was so stupid to let it slip away. She closes her eyes. A cry of anguish:

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Salt! Beat. Then Salt appears in the doorway holding a large plastic bag of Betsy's antiserum. Gillespie connects it to Robby's IV and the brown fluid flows into Robby. Gillespie sits down beside her. A long beat. Then he does: Something crazy. He removes the glove from his biosafety suit so that his own bare hand can touch Robby's skin. He touches her face gently. HOLD ON Gillespie, sitting beside his wife's bed, holding her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Massive Chinook HELICOPTERS RUMBLE over the staging area, loaded down by the weight of the nerve gas they carry in their bellies and the spray rigs which protrude on both sides of the fuselage. Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: ROBBY'S ROOM
dialogues.text: The wall clock declares 11:30. Robby's still comatose.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: I was wrong. The antiserum doesn't work. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Salt shares his despair. A long beat. Gillespie hands Salt a paper.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Take this. A signed declaration by me that at all times you were following my orders -- Now get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: -- No, sir. Gillespie's moved:

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: You'll be the only person left alive who knows the truth --

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: -- But, sir --

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: -- You will leave! You will not disobey an order.

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: (very emotionally) Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: B
dialogues.text: c)

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: In the pouring RAIN, Ford surveys the vast machine he's assembled: Soldiers in Chemwar gear pile boxes of body bags into trucks. Tractor drivers REV their ENGINES and THUNDER forward to the front line of Chinooks carrying the poison gas. Corpsmen check their watches and flash their signal lights. The CHINOOKS THUNDER into the air.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: All the parts move with such precision he should be proud But he's deeply troubled. He moves:  131.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUZZING with activity. Dr. Frankle and McClintock stand beside the computerized map of the quarantine area which shows the red perimeter is within a half mile of the Columbia River. The clock reads 23:47. The RADIO CRACKLES with a Louisiana drawl from the Squadron Commander of the nerve gas team; we'll know him as Sandman One.

dialogues.speaker: SANDMAN ONE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: General, we got a problem. It's rainin' pitchforks up heah. The damn rain will dilute it down, barely be strong enough to kill a cat. Frankle's troubled too:

dialogues.speaker: DR. FRANKLE
dialogues.text: He's right. Ford agonizes.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: To implement the plan and to kill only a portion of the population... That would cause great harm and solve nothing. McCLINTOCK Sir!! The nerve gas rapidly loses its potency after it's mixed. The choppers have got enough to make two runs. The virus is a quarter mile from the river. You've got to go forward. Ford wavers. He grabs the radio mike:

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Stand down!! Return your squadron to base and stand down until you receive further orders.

dialogues.speaker: SANDMAN ONE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Acknowledge. Return to base. Ford moves into:

dialogues.speaker: HIS PRIVATE OFFICE
dialogues.text: a highly secure area, sound-proofed for top-secret commu- nications. McClintock follows him in and slams the door shut. They're completely alone. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: McCLINTOCK How are you going to stop the virus from reaching the river?

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Napalm everything from the town outward. McCLINTOCK In the rain, the napalm will burn unevenly.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: I'll take that chance. McCLINTOCK The virus will escape and we'll have to use nuclear weapons to sterlize the area.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: I gave you my orders. Beat. Then quietly: McCLINTOCK Let's say the antiserum did work, General. You'd bus out the people, move ‘em somewhere, and treat 'em. And with luck some of them would live. But it's not going to work and in the meantime you don't understand what you've done.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: I understand perfectly. McCLINTOCK No, you don't. We can't fool the media forever. They'll ask questions... there'll be inquiries... What we did was important. What we did was right, sir. A long beat. Ford knows he's ruined either way he turns. McClintock's despair is deep and profound. Ford feels sorry for him, but: (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, but my decision stands. If there is any hope of avoiding this horrible contingency, I've got to... McClintock has slowly drawn his belt out of his trousers. He quickly throws it around Ford's neck, crosses it, and pulls violently on the two ends. Ford kicks and struggles, but he's no match for McClintock's strength. McCLINTOCK I am relieving you of command on the basis of cowardice in the face of a national emergency. Ford's dead. McClintock lays him out on the floor. Opens the door and screams into the main room. McCLINTOCK Help! He starts doing CPR as aides rush in. McCLINTOCK Call the medics quickly. The General's had a heart attack. One aide grabs the phone and calls the medics. Two more take over CPR. McClintock straightens his shirt and moves back into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCLINTOCK I am assuming command under the authority of the Secretary of Defense. PAN AROUND the room: Faces of uncertainty and fear. McClintock grabs the radio mike: McCLINTOCK Sandman One, this is General McClintock. You are to proceed with nerve gas dispersal. You will make two runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shares a look of concern with his co-pilot.  134.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO COMMAND CENTER
dialogues.text: A long beat. Then:

dialogues.speaker: SANDMAN ONE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salt drives up in a Jeep. Immediately he's surrounded by MP's, and taken into custody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gillespie stares out the window at the rain. Just visible in the distance: The blue and red lights of the approaching Chinooks. He moves back toward Robby, still comatose. The bag of Betsy's antiserum is empty. He reaches for Robby's hand. Her finger twitches. Beat. Her eyes open. Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: NURSING STATION
dialogues.text: Gillespie grabs one phone. The line's dead. He grabs another. Dead. He throws it aside. Races to the window. The choppers' lights burn brighter.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: Stop! But nobody's listening. He runs down the hall screaming. Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: SANDMAN ONE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: General McClintock, we are ready to commence phase one. McCLINTOCK Proceed.  135.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAJOR
dialogues.text: agonizing. He leaves his post.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAJOR
dialogues.text: Sir, General Ford ordered -- McCLINTOCK Sit down, Major, or I will have you arrested. The Young Major hesitates. McClintock draws his pistol. Salt enters, escorted by two MP's. The MP's survey the situation, with the General facing off against a young Major. What the hell is going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: races for the Black Hawk. Throws the door open and grabs the RADIO. A beat, then it FLICKERS to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gillespie's voice rings out over the radio:

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Stop! The antiserum works. McCLINTOCK Turn it off! The radioman hesitates. INTERCUT Sandman One in his chopper.

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This is Colonel Gillespie. And I'm ordering you... begging you... to stop. We can save these people. McClintock punches off the radio.

dialogues.speaker: ON FACES OF OFFICERS
dialogues.text: in the room, wavering. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: You do this, every night for the rest of your life you will wake up screaming. INTERCUT Sandman One. A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: SANDMAN ONE
dialogues.text: This is Sandman One... we are returning to base. McCLINTOCK (into radio) You will be shot for dereliction of duty in a national crisis. Do you understand? Sandman One doesn't answer. McClintock turns to the Young Major. McCLINTOCK Order him to proceed. The Young Major hesitates. McClintock points the gun at his head. The Young Major trembles, but shakes his head "no."

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: No! McClintock turns the gun to Salt.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAJOR
dialogues.text: No, sir... Please. McCLINTOCK I cannot allow a catastrophe to occur -- He puts the PISTOL into his own mouth and PULLS the TRIGGER. Dead silence. Then:

dialogues.speaker: SALT
dialogues.text: (to the Young Major) As the ranking officer, you are in command... (punching on the radio) Until --  137.

dialogues.speaker: AT BLACK HAWK
dialogues.text: Gillespie has heard this entire action on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: SALT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Colonel Gillespie gets here. Gillespie pulls his coat up over his head to shield himself from the driving RAIN and begins to run toward the quarantine perimeter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rain has stopped, as if for a brief moment man's battle with nature has been suspended. Buses loaded with the townspeople of Bonneville pass by. We recognize the Police Chief, Tommy Hulls' wife and children, Sherry Templeton's kids. All the windows and doors of the buses have been sealed with tape. TRACK PAST Betsy being loaded into the back of a van TO:

dialogues.speaker: GILLESPIE
dialogues.text: pushing Robby on her gurney into an Army truck. He seals the back tight with tape. Then climbs inside:

dialogues.speaker: CAB
dialogues.text: Salt turns the key and the ENGINE ROARS to life. Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eerie silence. A PLANE CRUISES over the forest on the Bonneville side. A waxy grey cloud fills the air. One second. Two seconds. The forest erupts in a wall of fire.

dialogues.speaker: CONVOY OF TRUCKS AND BUSES
dialogues.text: heading out of town. The fire burns in the b.g. As the end of the convoy leaves the town, PLANES ROAR by. As they drop a waxy grey cloud over the town of Bonneville --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A C-5A transport gliding to a landing on a runway carved out of the desert. Waiting anxiously for the plane to disembark: Wally, Mike, and Robby, in a wheelchair. They move forward to greet the small African man who emerges from the plane. Dr. Iwabi smiles and quickens his pace. The cargo hold doors open to reveal cage after cage of Colobos monkeys.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK SCREEN
dialogues.text: COMPUTER KEYS POUND; the letters leap ACROSS the SCREEN: November 21 -- the CDC announced that no evidence of aquatic spread of the Motaba Virus had ever been obtained and that its intensive monitoring of the Columbia River would be scaled back. March 14 -- researchers at the University of San Francisco announced the production of the first synthetic antibodies effective against the mutated Motaba Bonnevill strain. Mass production of the antibodies began four weeks later at the CDC and at the Military Disease Institute. May 12 -- Dr. Roberta Keough and General Michael Gillespi were married for the second time. ROLL CREDITS and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gila monster hunts for prey, its eye darting back and forth, its tongue twitching hungrily. It moves past: The barbed-wire fence emblazoned with the sign warning:

dialogues.speaker: PROHIBITED."
dialogues.text: Behind the fence the duplexes are dark and abandoned. The gila monster catches a fly and disappears into the night. FADE OUT.
